author: K Sullivan
text: "Love this place! I've been looking for a good Pho restaurant for a while."

author: Alex Moskal
text: 'Go here. Great banh mi
column5: great pho
column6: great vermicelli
column7: great iced coffee. Everything was great.'

author: Qin C. Xue
text: "Was craving some Pho and first time having it in NJ. The flavor was good
column5: but the portion are WAAAYYYY too small for an adult. I'm a skinny asian guy and feel like this pho was made for a 5y/o kid. And the lemongrass beef we ordered was spicy (very spicy) and I think it not supposed to be"

author: Michaela Deitrick
text: 'This place is my go-to for comfort food. The staff is really efficient
column5: and their pho tastes awesome. They always read my "special requests" section of the online ordering
column6: which I really appreciate!'

author: Yue ZHANG
text: 'favorite Asian restaurant in Hoboken! Love the beef stew and pho. Great outdoor seats.'

author: Sri Hartono
text: 'Delicious taste...good portion...and reasonable price'

author: Abby Washuta
text: 'This place is such a delight. Fast service and the grilled pork and grilled chicken vermicelli has such a good grilled flavor. Love it.'

author: Tom Digges
text: 'I love this place! Their food never disappoints (my faves are the lettuce wraps
column5: gyoza
column6: and the Bahn Mi).\n\nStaff is always very friendly and the prices are VERY reasonable (though the portion sizes aren‚Äôt massive like you get at some other takeout restaurants. Pho is the exception
column7: you get a good amount of Pho in one order.\n\nI wish I lived closer!'

author: Marlee Ann-Marie
text: 'Love this place! Great authentic food. The best pho'

author: Shareen Fatima
text: 'It‚Äôs a sweet little spot for Vietnamese cuisine in Hoboken. Their portion sizes for Pho are quite big and could easily be shared between two people. The summer roll was colorful and quite delish. The staff are nice and friendly. Would definitely recommend the place.'

author: Qingchen Dang
text: 'There is a Chinese female waitress who gave the worst service ever.'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Great pho and pork banh mi. Very reasonably priced and the food was so tasty. I would definitely recommend this place and am excited to try the other things on their menu.'

author: Cassandra Jones
text: 'Will only eat Pho from Pho Nomenon! Not only is it out of this world but their customer service is A1. I literally eat here at least once per week'

author: lora hong
text: 'Nice place! And nice food!'

author: Kevin Devaney
text: 'Have friendly staff.  The food was great'

author: William Lezama
text: 'Best pho I‚Äôve had in my life. Great food and amazing service! One of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken'

author: Jack Tolkien
text: 'Went during the week available seating had a really great soup!!! The noddles and okra is really great!! Would recommend this place to everyone!!!!'

author: Andre Cotto (Trustdre)
text: "Went with my 13 year old
column5: at first we thought the portions were small but after eating it turned out it was plenty and the food was very good so quantity versus quality it's worth it. As far as Covid rules I think the table could be a little father apart and the menus should be cleaned in between handling of different customers. We did enjoy out time. They get get a lot of togo orders and are more focused on that
column6: I can see why. Good for take out and customers and owners. I recommend it
column7: sure I'll go back in the future."

author: Kevin Opuoro
text: 'Their packaging is terrible
column5: I‚Äôve had 3 instances where the bag completely collapses when I pick it up. On top of that the food looks horrible and bland. Not even sure how this restaurant has business. The employees are also rude. Stay away from this disgusting place.'

author: Suejay Lopez
text: 'I ordered pho and they ran out of mint
column5: onion etc. instead of calling to inform me they sent my order..... won‚Äôt be ordering from here again.'

author: Rui S
text: 'Beef stew!'

author: Ed Wiegner
text: 'Great food and incredible service'

author: Coco The Maltese
text: 'Food is okay
column5: server is not friendly'

author: J PARK
text: "I ordered pho and spring roll using the food delivery app. Actually
column5: I didn't expect much because my regular restaurant was closed and it was a kind of alternative. But the food was so good
column6: especially the spring roll was amazing! The delivery time also took not so long."

author: Some Car guy
text: 'Rude people'

author: Eric Chow
text: 'Can‚Äôt ask for more in Hoboken area. Cant go wrong with any pho. Order the spring rolls and beef cubes.'

author: Xiaoyin Liu
text: "I ordered pick up and found  plastic chip in my pho noodle soup after I arrived home. It is so gross... It is not a large piece
column5: but smaller size makes it more dangerous. I can't imagine if you give your kids this and the kid swallowed it... ...\n\nPlus the noodle is undercooked
column6: I have to microwave the food for 90 seconds. Of course I did that before I found that plastic chip.\n\nWill never come back and don't recommend this place to anyone. Food is badly cooked and quality control is far below acceptable."

author: Roberto Vilchez
text: "The food was great and service was fantastic. The staff was really friendly and attentive. I wish I lived closer so I can order when I don't want to cook. The apps and pho were so good. Highly recommend this restaurant."

author: Frank White
text: 'Wow! Hidden gem
column5: everything on point !! Delicious and Fresh!'

author: Isa Skit so
text: 'The food was amazing would eat here again'

author: Dakota Van Deursen
text: "Wonderful spot for a meal alone or with friends -- delicious food that won't break the bank. I eat here so much
column5: the staff knows my order! If you're dining in
column6: order yourself a bowl of pho. (P1 is my suggestion
column7: if you're an adventurous eater.) For pick-up

author: Andrew Smith
text: 'Excellent food
column5: friendly staff members
column6: regularly fantastic atmosphere. They charge fair rates and the food quality is excellent. Fantastic work.'

author: Pia T.
text: 'Pho is okay
column5: but the price and location makes it worth it. Perfect if you‚Äôre sick and need something more than just chicken noodle soup.'

author: Nirav Mehta
text: 'Excellent food
column5: perfect spicy for me!!'

author: Morris Logsdon
text: 'This is honestly an OK place. Yes the Pho can be a bit more authentic
column5: and the service can be a bit faster. But you get a sub $10 lunch with so many menu choices! I am just glad that we have a Pho place here instead of another bar or pizza joint.'

author: lori hasert
text: 'First time here it was amazing'

author: Vu Tran
text: 'Not the best pho in the world but gets the job done.'

author: Matthew Hernandez
text: 'Delicious food
column5: friendly staff'

author: Jennifer Spadavecchia
text: 'My favourite in Hoboken.'

author: David Rhee
text: 'Greta pho place in hoboken..'

author: Liza Gomelski
text: 'I get the grilled chicken Pho with bokchoy once a week. So so good. Happy belly!'

author: W
text: 'Super yummy pho place. Get P9 with pork!!'

author: Kimberli Taylor
text: 'Simply the best Pho soup! Also the staff is so gracious.  It just warms my heart and stomach.  I keep going back for a great experience.  And the delivery is quick!'

author: Robert Koch
text: 'Our go-to for food in Hoboken. We absolutely love the vegetable pho with beef broth (GF gets it every time). I switch between different items but love P7.\n\nWe come here a lot
column5: so we naturally became friendly with the family that runs it. They are hospitable
column6: friendly
column7: and welcoming and make us feel at home even when we order takeout. We bring everyone we know here or recommend it.'

author: Annelise Dal Maso
text: "It's definitely pho weather! this place is a gem. Very neat service
column5: my pho tai was beyond delicious and i will surely come back. The only thing i would suggest is to put more napkins at the table"

author: J S
text: 'If you like Pho- & your in Hoboken... This is the place to go üôÇüëçüëçüëç\n-Not a fan of the appetizers..\nPhoto is. Authentic and delicious'

author: Hudson Shi
text: 'the shrimp roll is so good'

author: Enkelejd Ceka
text: 'First time eating Pho. It was delicious!'

author: Carol Chen
text: "Not enough flavor. The pho wasnt hot and the soup is very watery. The beef was terribly tough. I got my food almost immediately so considering the taste
column5: the pho must be assembled already and poured with warm diluted soup. On the plus side
column6: it's fast and relatively cheap. And I have had worse experience. Would I come here again? Only if I am really hungry for something quick."

author: RICARDO DIAZ
text: 'This place was fast
column5: friendly and delicious'

author: Andrea A
text: 'One of my favorite places in Hoboken. I love coming here during the lunch special because they are well worth the price. Not only that but the service is quick and friendly. I have never had a bad experience here and many of my friends go here as well! As a student it is affordable and close to campus so what more could you want? When my parents visited me in Hoboken I took them here and they loved it as well!'

author: Huan Do
text: 'Dry
column5: portion is small for the price'

author: Joseph Aubourg
text: 'Great food'

author: ziranshu Zhang
text: '(Translated by Google) Traveling around to watch online reviews to eat
column5: the taste is okay
column6: if I live nearby
column8:
but I will not be able to eat on a business trip. I have eaten better pho in the United States.

author: Kushal Mukherjee
text: "Tried ordering from them for delivery. I am in Lincoln Harbor less than a mile from their restaurant and they wanted a 25 minimum. Doesn't seem like a restaurant confident in their menu."

author: Tara Cioletti
text: 'I‚Äôve had mall food court pad Thai that was better. It looked dry and was kinda sticky and a bit cold
column5: like it had been sitting there for a while. There was no bean sprouts or anything
column6: and the tiniest little shrimp I‚Äôve ever seen! Also had a red type of sauce on it- looked like it would be nice and spicy but...nope. Didn‚Äôt have  much flavor at all.'

author: Melissa Ramirez
text: 'Delicious pho
column5: nice staff'

author: Viracchi
text: 'Always get pho here from delivery
column5: but stopping in it was nice and filling and the quantity fresh in the bowl is even more delicious.'

author: Avishay Cohen
text: 'Great pho selection. Tasty food. Friendly staff! I would recommend visiting for anyone who likes Vietnamese food.'

author: Giovanni Munoz
text: "It's good food. I haven't had much vietnamese food so not much to compare it too but if you go the lettuce wraps are great and so it the pho. Everything else to me personally I'm not a fan."

author: Steven Giacomelli
text: 'Delicious pho in a great family run restaurant environment'

author: Felix Brooks
text: 'Food is Outstanding
column5: kinda lame on the Service tho'

author: Christopher Drummond
text: 'I eat here a lot.  Good food and good price.'

author: Chloe Bergman-Ray
text: 'We love this place - one of our favorites in Hoboken. Excellent service
column5: BYOB
column6: and delicious pho (and other dishes too!).'

author: Gregory Mazza
text: 'Excellent service
column5: prices
column6: and food. It‚Äôs not the most outstanding bowl of pho I‚Äôve had in my life
column7: but it was still exceptional and more than fits the spot. As a bonus
column8: I went on a particularly chilly night
column9: and we got complimentary hot tea

author: Andrew DaPonte
text: 'If you want a pho-nominal meal
column5: you will love Phonomenon. With its unassuming appearance
column6: this restaurant packs a powerful punch. The Pho is flavorful and generous
column9: although intimidating has many great options. Oh..and the complimentary tea is a great touch!\n\nJalape√±os aren‚Äôt provided for every Pho - but if you ask you will receive them (free of charge).'

author: Rachel Difiore
text: "Love the decor and ambiance here. It's very modern
column5: classy
column6: and spacious. As for the food
column7: I felt like it was nothing special and worth remembering. We ordered the tuna poke
column8: garlic noodles and kimchi fried rice. The noodles and rice were a bit sweet and tasted just alright. They're both nothing I would crave again."

author: Rachel Cipkins
text: 'Very fast service!'

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: "Pho real tho
column5: this place has some above average pho. I also learned how to use chopsticks while eating here. They didn't teach me
column6: but there's still sentimental value in that
column7: yanno? Still not enough for 5 stars."

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: 'This is a very high 4 stars
column5: more like a 4.4. The food was very good
column6: as well as the service. My only knock is that other pho places have been better tasting.'

author: Robert Frusina
text: 'Great portion size and great pho. Best in the area'

author: Michael De
text: "Good portions. They have tofu as a vegan substitute. Peanut Sauce is a must try.\n\nStick to specials or you'll be spending like 15$."

author: stephen wu
text: 'Great food and good service'

author: Kelly Dao
text: 'I ordered the B3 Spring roll with lemongrass and beef vermeccelli. This is not Vietnamese food. There\'s red and green peppers and bean sprouts over other mess. It looked like they tried to have a spicy oil base sauce but there\'s no taste
column5: it\'s just oily. NO fishsauce like an authentic version of this dish would have and no flavor. The bag was also soaked and drenched from this "sauce".'

author: Steve
text: "Great place
column5: cheap.   Didn't care for the odor inside so ate outside.   Get the #6
column6: Grilled Pork with Noodles"

author: Andrew Nguyen
text: 'Decent good here. Not really the best tasting and the portions are a little on the small side.'

author: Lorelei Morrow
text: 'Best pho in town - and the chicken lettuce wraps are also a hit!  My boyfriend and I come here every Sunday.'

author: sonu patel
text: 'I and my friend were passing by the street and decided to give vietnamese food a try. We ordered a single dish as we were not that hungry. The guy working there said they have a policy that they charge extra if the dish is shared! When I asked them about this policy
column5: the guy responded very rudely! Horrible service and policy!'

author: Calixto Morales
text: 'Great food. Descent portions and fresh. Lots of people say that customer service is bad but I think the tasty food and low prices make up for any of that.'

author: Katie Swift
text: 'Excellent service and rich pho. Super reasonably priced and attentive waitstaff made dinner in a larger group a pleasure.'

author: Pri Robin
text: "Best Southern Pho I had in Jersey!! I give 5 stars for all the Pho dishes. Absolutely healthy and very pleasant taste and after taste. I visited this once a week during Lunch hours for more than 2 years and I never got bored of the taste. Haven't really tried many other items but the ones I did are pretty decent. I would any day visit this place for PHO."

author: Wei Xin Yuan
text:
"Pretty mediocre place.

Service so so. I didn't like the way the staff don't greet you on the way out but seem to look the other way.

Vegetarian options are very few and honestly don't look appetizing at all. Pho isn't hot enough to cook the bean sprouts. The beef is already pretty well cooked in the soup. Soup itself doesn't feel well done enough.

But it is hoboken so I am not expecting a lot to begin with."

author: Meghan Salviejo
text: 'If I could give 0 stars I would. The customer service here is awful. I ordered a B3 lemongrass beef with spring roll vermicelli noodles and extra vegetables expecting it to be a traditional
column5: commonly known Vietnamese dish. Instead I got Chinese mixed vegetables in oyster sauce dumped on top of vermicelli noodles. I called in to ask for a replacement/refund only to be told I was the one who ordered incorrectly
column6: and that the dish has a "stir fry." Since when have Vietnamese vermicelli dishes had Chinese stir fry on it? She then proceeded to tell me to just take the vegetables off and was unwilling to compromise. I\'ve never had such a horrible experience at a restaurant before. They can\'t even call themselves a Vietnamese restaurant. Definitely lost a loyal customer who has been ordering for 2 years. Don\'t waste your time or money on this place.'

author: Gillibee
text: 'Very good pho. Perfect on a cold day'

author: Ken U
text: "(Translated by Google) I went to eat with the introduction of an acquaintance in the United States. I don't have many opportunities to eat Vietnamese food
column5: but I think you may like it or not. The store is small and clean. It is not a big shop
column6:
but it seems to be popular.

(Original)

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Pho Nomenon is not the best Vietnamese food you'll ever have in the NYC/NJ area. I wasn't expecting it to be. What I was expecting was my go to for a hangover cure - a steaming hot bowl of pho
column5: and it did the trick. The broth could have been hotter but overall
column6: I was pretty happy with my decision to try this place out. My boyfriend and I came around 3 pm on a Saturday and there weren't many people dining - probably because it was a weird hour
column7: and it was also the Saturday before Halloween so people were probably busy prepping for their parties that night. We also tried the banh mi
column8: which was okay. Like I mentioned
column9: it's not the best Viet food but it is the only option in Hoboken so I'll definitely hit up this spot next time the craving for Vietnamese (or next time a hangover) hits.\n\nTip - don't sit outside. Service is very limited."

author: Stan Fernandes
text: "It's okay. I ordered the classic pad thai and it was a little sweet. I thought it tasted like it was probably made with ketchup. My wife ordered the seafood soup and she liked it. My son ordered chicken and vegetables and he thought it was good. It's okay if you want to give it a try but don't have high expectations."

author: Omar Aly
text: 'Food is not that great'

author: Kyle Stewart
text: 'Ordered a bahn mi - it was weak sauce
column5: service could be a wee better as well honestly'

author: April Lin
text: 'Good lunch place to go
column5: fast and delicious.'

author: Liza Cucco
text: "I ordered Bun
column5: same thing I get at every Vietnamese restaurant
column6: unless It is a cold day and a steamy bowl of pho sounds better. I love it
column7: one of my favorite meals-warm grilled or pan fried meat served over cold rice vermicelli with fresh herbs and veggies and a lovely light fish sauce. Here
column8: what I got was a hot beef and pepper stir fry over what seems closer to hot spaghetti pasta
column9: with a little pile of lettuce next to it. What a disappointment. The stir fry was tasty
column10: despite being a bit oily for my taste
column11: but just wasn't what I was expecting. It doesn't seem this is a typical Vietnamese restaurant- wouldn't go here if you are looking for the light fresh and delicious food the cuisine is known for. My husband thought his Bahn Mi was good but I didn't try it."

author: Rich Hernandez
text: 'Tried 3 dishes and all have been over salted. I no longer eat there'

author: Nicki Usiondek
text: 'I love this place. Everything is delicious and authentic. The staff is friendly and the restaurant is clean. I eat here at least once a week.'

author: Eugenio Lopez
text: "Food was great and staff was very attentive. Between my girlfriend and I
column5: we ordered the grilled chicken sandwich
column6: b6 pork vermachili
column8: and it was all great. We'll definitely be returning.\nSidenote
column9: it's byob and the liquor store is down the block;)"

author: Aida Isay
text: 'Overall
column5: food was very good! Especially b6(grilled pork with meatballs and vermicelli) and chicken sandwich! The pho soup was good after adding house sauce in it. Servers were very attentive and nice. Plus they have byob policy!\nThis place should definitely be busier on Saturday night!'

author: Chanel Brown-Legon
text:
'I came here after having a serious craving for ph≈ç so I popped into Pho Nomenon.

I ordered calamari and beef pho. The calamari was crispy and the skin kept falling off but it was fresh and tasted excellent with the sweet and sour (possibly duck?) orange sauce.

When the ph≈ç came out I was very excited to try it despite the poor reviews. Needless to say
column5:
I was very underwhelmed. It lacked flavor and I could only eat half of the bowl.

The waitress was accommodating but not extremely friendly.

Overall rating = Ph≈ç Nom e No'

author: Caroline Courtney
text: 'First time having pho
column5: and it was delicious! BYOB policy turned out to be a great one!'

author: Andrew Shang
text: 'Lunch specials are quite flavorful for the price you pay'

author: Javier Del Rio Jr
text: "Their Pho wasn't the best. But the service was good."

author: Nikhil Maheswaraiah
text: 'Good lunch menu'

author: Organic Kid
text: 'Came here with wife. Seafood soup had 1 cold
column5: frozen shrimp. 2 brocolli
column6: no noodles
column9: and all of this in clear hot water - that they called soup. No taste at all - stay away at all costs.Pork Meat is burnt
column11:
summer rolls are garbage. Went across the street to bearburger right after to get weird taste out of mu mouth and actually get some food. Oo and crab meat in the seafood soup tasted like a cadaver. Stay away. Gagggggggggggggggggg

In response to owner:
It wasnt on the menu. Your cheff and YOU should be ashamed to serve that type of.... i dont know what cuz its not soup. Also if cheff sees meat is burnt dont serve it lol - burnt is burnt no matter who is eating. Anyway just take my money and dont make excuses - like i said stay away from this nasty place'

author: Hamza Mohamed
text: 'Fantastic banh mi. They have a 10$ min on credit cards
column5: but a bubble tea and a banh mi come out to 12
column6: so that worked out!  Free hot tea on rainy days and free water on hot days.  Love this place!!'

author: Mandi Abdalla Hernandez-Jimenez (MahJ)
text: 'Great selections
column5: great prices and delicious food. Sweet attentive service. Lisa is the best!'

author: PJ Tuohy
text: 'Average place to get pho and other related foods.'

author: Chris Davidson
text: 'Good pho
column5: not a bad price
column6: but nothing spectacular. Good standby place.'

author: yiming wang
text:
'(Translated by Google) What dishes are delicious?

(Original)
‰ªÄ‰πàËèúÈÉΩÂ•ΩÂêÉÁöÑ'

author: Max Mayer
text: "Amazing fusion Vietnamese food.  The Pho soup is a stunning combination of flavors that complement one another perfectly
column5: with a wide varieties to choose from
column6: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.  They do have more traditional dishes if that's what you're looking for
column7: the menu is clear and it has enough variety to return visits interesting without making your first time overwhelming.  Warm and friendly staff

author: Debi Buzunis
text: 'Excellent PHO. Super friendly and effective staff. Love the Jasmin tea.'

author: Bridget ‚ÄúBD‚Äù Williams
text: 'My favorite place for ph√¥ in North Jersey. Highly recommend the phenomenon ph√¥ and the chicken summer rolls'

author: Francis Botero
text: 'Tasty noodles with good sized portions. BBQ beef was good.'

author: Ondrej Dolejsi
column5: do it nao!'

author: Qun Li
text: "I finally had a chance to try their pho. It's pretty good."

author: Markus Henry Scheidel
text: 'I love this place. absolutely amazing pho. the people are so nice and the food is so authentic. legit the best part of my day is walking in here. P9 is great.'

author: SteveY
text: 'Bahn mi sandwich is delicious'

author: Jinfei Cheng
text: 'Grilled pork chop is good!'

author: Á∫ΩÁ∫¶Â∞èÂº∫
text: 'The food is little
column5: but the price is twice than other Chinese restaurant. Also the service is indifferent. Guys
column6: never go this place twice!'

author: Keith Jackson
text: "Decent place. Only ordered from here so can't comment on the atmosphere. Would like to see a little more flair or ethnic flavor I the food."

author: amruta chintawar
text: "The vegetarian pho didn't have any taste. Just veggies in clear soup. May be other broths are good."

author: Stephanie Tom
text: "When I'm sick and in need of comfort food
column5: or when it's a terrible cold and gray night
column6: I turn to Phonomenal. While it might not measure up to what you can get in Cali or even Flushing or Chinatown
column7: it's surprisingly good Vietnamese food. All of the workers are also very nice and I've never had a bad service experience.\n\nA tip: if you get a bowl of pho
column8: whether ordering online or in person
column9: make sure you get the beef bone broth. That has the most flavor and true umami taste."

author: Victoria Verdel
text: 'I love this place. Service is fast. Food is very tasty and prices are great! Hope this places stays around for a long time'

author: Angelo
text: "Terrible experience. The chicken skewers were burnt. The lettuce and sliced carrots didnt taste fresh. My pregnant wife ordered their pad thai and didn't like it. She had one bite and that was it. They still charged us! Lady telling us it's their policy to charge even if we didn't eat it. Whatever happened to the customer is right and showing good faith and professionalism. Never coming back! Try Rice Shop down the next block
column5: so much better!"

author: Peter Kalliney
text: 'The Pho and vermicelli were great. The prices are very reasonable and the food is excellent. On top of all of that
column5: its BYOB which makes it a gem.'

author: Frank Deste
text: 'Nice but needs more flare food OK also'
